programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Lila B. has earned Mike Hammer's attention for a number of reasons, not least of which is her intoxicating voice. But the beautiful jazz singer also has a dangerous side, keeping company with mobsters. When her beaux arrested, he's forced rat on his partners. The plot thickens when one of Lila's gentlemen called is killed and she becomes a suspect. With both the police and the mob on her heels, Hammer is determined to keep the songstress safe.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Lila B. is in the wind, terrified that she may have seen something to precipitate the murders. Mike Hammer finds a way to post bail and sets out to track the jazz singer down. But with Lila on the lam and Hammer on her trail, the death toll continues to rise and raise the cops' suspicions. Lila reunites with Johnny Dive, and both find themselves face to face with danger when mobsters get a hold of them.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Mike can't wait to hit the open road and go bass fishing with Skip. The first stop on their trip is Lou's bar. A pleasant morning turns into a dangerous afternoon when Hammer realizes that a team of violent bank robbers is sitting at the next table. The situation spirals and after a shoot out that leaves Grady wounded, the volatile men and their lingerie-clad femme fatale hold everyone in the bar hostage. Now, Hammer must keep everyone safe and stop the criminals, all without his gun.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: The former secretary of an old friend, Simon, visits Mike Hammer with a theory about her old boss's sudden death. Mike chalks up her death to Simon's adventurous streak, until he shows up alive in his apartment. Simon reveals how he continued to play dead after a hired assassin took shots at him and two other hunting buddies. Looking for revenge, Simon talks Mike into helping him track down his assassin, and hunt that takes the private eye all the way to California. However, Mike soon after meets danger on this journey.

programme.desc: As a new era of exploration of the Red Planet begins, the Red Planet's mysteries might be close to getting solved; ancient cataclysms are believed to have left Mars barren, but science continues to find clues that this red planet was once blue.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Despite all of our modern technology and sophistication, there is much that we still don't know about what lies beneath our feet, deep underground.

programme.title: The UnXplained

programme.title: Episode 7
programme.desc: Who is the real ‚ÄòLoose Cannon‚Äô? Lily Newhouse is the amateur who qualified to play in this high stakes cash game. But it‚Äôs Las Vegas businessman Dave Krosky who‚Äôs confusing pros like Sam Grafton with his unpredictable playing style.

programme.title: Episode 8
programme.desc: More high stakes action from Las Vegas. ‚ÄòLoose Cannon‚Äô Lily Newhouse switches up her style, while local entrepreneur Dave Krosky sticks to his maverick methods. But have the pros finally started to figure him out?

programme.title: Episode 9
programme.desc: The penultimate session of this high stakes cash games sees Las Vegas businessman Dave Krosky test the patience of his opponents. Meanwhile, pro players Maria Ho and Sam Grafton clash in a huge pot.

programme.title: Episode 10
programme.desc: The pressure is on, as this high stakes Vegas poker game concludes. Loose Cannon Lily only has a few hands left to make a profit. Can she find a spot? Meanwhile, Dave is playing wilder than ever.

programme.title: The CUT
programme.desc: J.T. Poston wins the 2024 Shriners Children's Open and captures his third PGA TOUR victory. Rickie Fowler plays pickleball with Shriners Ambassador Grayson, who was born without a femur and two fingers on his left hand. Taylor Montgomery talks about his 2024 season and overcoming injury. Look ahead to the ZOZO CHAMPIONSHIP where Collin Morikawa will look to defend his title, all on this week's episode of The CUT.

programme.title: 2024 ZOZO Championship
programme.desc: Nico Echavarria captures his second victory on the PGA TOUR after winning the 2024 ZOZO CHAMPIONSHIP. Echavarria shot rounds of 64-64-65-67 to finish 20-under.

programme.title: 2024 Barracuda Championship
programme.desc: Nick Dunlap wins the 2024 Barracuda Championship, becoming the first player in PGA TOUR history to win as an amateur and a professional in the same year.

programme.title: 2024 FedEx St. Jude Championship
programme.desc: Olympic bronze medalist Hideki Matsuyama captures his 10th PGA TOUR victory after winning the 2024 FedEx St. Jude Championship. This is his second win of the 2024 FedExCup Season.

programme.title: 2024 AT&T Pebble Beach Pro-Am
programme.desc: Wyndham Clark gets his third career win after his victory at a weather-shortened 2024 AT&T Pebble Beach Pro-Am. Clark broke the course record during the third round after shooting a 60. He finished 17-under par with rounds of 72-67-60.

programme.title: 2023 The Galleri Classic
programme.desc: Reliving the 2023 Galleri Classic, where David Toms climbed back into the winner's circle and claimed his third career PGA TOUR Champions title.

programme.title: 2024 RBC Canadian Open
programme.desc: Robert MacIntyre captures his first PGA TOUR victory after his win at the 2024 RBC Canadian Open. MacIntyre carded rounds of 64-66-66-68 to finish 16-under at Hamilton Golf & Country Club.

programme.desc: Joe pulls out all the stops to make the '66 Nova the car of his client's dreams; Joe doesn't just want a mean motor and big tires; he wants a chopped roof, but the car might be too far behind schedule for a chop, even if it does up the cool factor.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: Rocker Ted Nugent brings in his beloved '74 Bronco; Bill and the guys make an all-terrain beast unlike any other; With his creative sparks flying, Bill gets going on a build he's dreamed about for years: a handmade, all-tube, off-road buggy.

programme.title: Unique Rides
programme.desc: Team Unique transforms Mike Epps' Camaro convertible into a custom dream ride, with leather seating and a smoked-out trim treatment; Will and the team take on a one week conversion of a Jeep Sahara.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave's clients have owned a car since they got married 25 years ago and want it restored so they can enjoy it for another 25. While the shop isn't really into straight restorations, adding some custom pieces and paint makes them "say yes" to the pro.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave is thrilled with the latest build, while KevDogg is barely lukewarm; Dave has done double-cab VWs, Bugs and Karmann Ghias, but now he is taking on something completely different, and even more rare.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: Joe Martin brings new life to old iron at his shop Joe Martin Customs; working with his wife Amanda, and best friend Shag, this custom shop oversees every phase of restoration from design, fabrication and mechanicals, to the final paint job.

programme.title: Texas Metal

programme.title: Engine Masters

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. programme.title: Fort Dobbs
programme.desc: After escaping a lynch mob, Gar Davis (Clint Walker) disguises himself in a dead man's clothes and stumbles upon a farm. When Comanches attack the homestead, Gar leaps into action to defend the hapless residents -- widow Celia Gray (Virginia Mayo) and her son Chad (Richard Eyer). A tenuous romance develops between Gar and Celia when he escorts the family to Fort Dobbs. But everything changes when Celia discovers the stranger is wearing her dead husband's jacket.

programme.title: McLintock!
programme.desc: A cattle baron with the diplomatic savvy to keep peace between dueling power brokers in town can‚Äôt seem to get his wife and daughter under control.

programme.desc: Two sons of a Colorado cattle baron, one biological and the other adopted, grow up and fight for control of their father's business empire.

programme.title: The Legend of the Lone Ranger
programme.desc: The story of how the sole surviving Texas Ranger of an ambush by the Cavendish gang donned a mask and assumed a new identity as a justice warrior.

programme.title: The Last Outlaw
programme.desc: A former bandit finds the frontier a very different place when he emerges from prison after serving 25 years.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: When Cisco becomes suspicious of a group of strangers staying in Canyon City, he goads a young gunslinger into a duel.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco and Pancho stake out a prospector who is murdered after striking pay dirt.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco and Pancho try to prove the innocence of an eccentric old man who's known for giving away gold coins...but has now been charged with murder.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: When Cisco and Pancho find a dying archaeologist, they follow his partners into a lost city. The Inca princess believes Cisco and Pancho are trying to steal their treasures, so she imprisons them.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Alabama born Rube Burrows becomes infamous through the south for train robbery in the late 1880's but his girlfriend Emma is portrayed as the brains.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Former sheriff, Jim Courtright, runs a protection racket in 1880's Texas and takes drastic measures when men refuse to pay. Matt and Margaret arrive after a railroad man is killed.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt and Margaret investigate the kidnapping of banker Penrose from a stagecoach. They suspect noted bandit Milt Sharp who escaped from a Nevada prison and his partner Dutch.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Railroad $25,000 payroll is stolen by Jack Slade and his gang. Matt and Margaret set a trap to capture him.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt and Margaret head to Denver in the late 1860's after the killing of a railroad telegraph operator. Bail jumper L H Musgrove, a known horse thief is their chief suspect.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Railroad Detective Matt Clark (Jim Davis) and his assistant Frankie Adams (Mary Castle), investigate the stealing of a herd of horses belonging to the U. S. Cavalry.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Matt Clark sets out on the trail of a gang of cattle rustlers led by one of the West's youngest and most notorious outlaws, Billy Bonney, aka Billy the Kid.

programme.title: Hopalong Cassidy
programme.desc: When the bride-to-be's uncle is murdered on the eve of Lucky's wedding, it's up to Hoppy and California to solve his alongside other murders that are marring the occasion at the Last Chance Inn.

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: Sheriff Clay Hollister becomes suspicious of a former bank robber who comes to Tombstone.

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: Sheriff Hollister is concerned when Marshal Daggett, the Black marshal of Deadwood, arrives in Tombstone to settle down as a rancher.

programme.title: Bat Masterson
programme.desc: A Shawnee renegade and his band take two girls prisoner, but with the Army on its way to assist General Custer, only Bat remains to rescue the girls.

programme.title: Bat Masterson
programme.desc: After Bat loses his gun, horse and money to gambler Bailey Harper, he decides to regain his belongings by courting Bailey's girl.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas encourages a drunken artist charged with murder to use his talents to identify the true killer.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas and Mark try to persuade a persecuted young mute to return stolen money.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: When renegades attack peaceful Pawnee villages, Pahoo, Yancy and Colorado Charlie travel to Washington, D.C. with John Colton's letter of introduction in an attempt to enforce the terms of the Tablecreek Treaty made with the tribe. An administrator of the War Department, along with his gunrunning crony, attempt to obstruct Pahoo's mission by taking political, social, and violent steps against him.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Yancy agrees to "shoot" Charles LeBow in a fake duel in order to smoke out the man who's trying to kill LeBow. During the mock funeral, they find LeBow's partner shot dead in what should have been LeBow's empty coffin. programme.title: A Miracle on Christmas Lake
programme.desc: After suffering the loss of his best friend Charlie on Christmas Eve, sixteen year old Bobby Whiteside ventures out onto the lake where they played countless games of winter hockey. Upon shoveling the ice surface he makes a shocking discovery --- a magic, perfectly groomed hockey rink that appears only at night and only in his presence. When a local construction company purchases the land for development, Bobby must join forces with his high school crush, rally the town, and play one last game on the night pond --- with an old friend.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Friends Bed and Breakfast in Blackpool, Lancashire run by Luke and John Conway, who are the self-proclaimed unique selling point. But feedback from some leaves a bitter taste.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week the group head to The Lincoln Holiday Retreat, which owner Debbie Grant has built from the ground up over the past twenty years. However, some of the guests think the d√©cor is too dated.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Chapel in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, owned by Mark Hinchcliffe and Heidi Donohoe, who pride themselves on offering something special in their converted chapel.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Heather and Sally hope their fussy cleaning regime will impress their rivals at Brockley Hall Hotel in Yorkshire. But there are problems in some rooms, and the breakfast puzzles the guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Alistair, who has fitted out luxury hotels including The Savoy, welcomes his rivals to his refurbished village pub, The Star Inn 1744, where his breakfast ordering system raises questions.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Michelle and Jason welcome their rivals to their luxury lodges at Croft Farm Park in Gloucestershire. The guests go canoeing but some struggle to stay afloat when someone sticks his oar in.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Steve and Tracy welcome their rivals to their bed and breakfast Harbour Vista in Poole, and most of their guests are surprised that it's not more lavish, when they realise they are staying in Steve's house.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: In Grosmont, North Yorkshire, at Grosmont House B&B, mother and daughter Selma and Roxy hope their personal touch and attention to detail will win over their competitors.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Monkspool bed and breakdast in Twyning, Gloucestershire. The establishment is owned by husband and wife Paulo and Suzi Lacey, who pride themselves on their top-quality mattresses.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week, the group head to Pymgate Lodge Hotel in Cheadle, where Romanian husband and wife Michael and Leda Ardeleanu believe their hosting skills will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to pub, restaurant and bed and breakfast The Stag and Huntsman in Hambleden, Oxfordshire, managed by South African chef Marius Pretorius and his partner Sarah Harris.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Weymouth, Dorset at The Somerset House Hotel, run by couple Adam and Holly, who hope their boutique rooms and BBQ breakfast will whet their guests' appetite.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Dawlish in Devon, where owner of The Knitting Hotel Belinda Harris-Reid and colleague Brenda Watson are hoping their guests get excited about all things woolly.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week the group head to Stade Court Hotel in Hythe in Kent, where the owners, Sandeep and Vaishalee Chawla, have a hosting policy of treating their guests like a god.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mandy McCready and her assistant Sam Gould welcome their rivals to the Goodlife Guest House, a family business in Harwich in Essex.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Ronnie and Steph Caird welcome their rivals to Inn at the Park in Aberdeen. where it is all about keeping it in the family. But one guest's culinary background piles on the pressure for Ronnie at breakfast.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Shauna and Fiona welcome their rivals to Ingliston Country Club in Renfrewshire. But Steve and Allard think the d√©cor is dated, and a breakfast waiting game causes a storm in a teacup.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Steve and Allard welcome their rivals to 1692 Wasdale in the Lake District. Fiona and Shauna think it's picture perfect, but other guests face tricky technology and cleanliness concerns.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to Blackpool and confident John welcomes his rivals to the Lynbar Hotel. He says his breakfast is the best in Blackpool and hopes his guests will agree.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Pencader, Wales and the School House bed and breakfast, owned by eco-friendly couple Jayne and Ian, where they hope their environmental approach will win over their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Cathedral 73 in Cardiff, managed by Neil Chidzey and Assistant Manager Jo Goodwin. Guests are wowed by the glamorous rooms, but the costs prove hard to swallow.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week the group head to Leafy Suburban bed and breakfast in Northwood, where golfer Raj Kumar opens the doors to his home. However, Neil and Jo are not impressed with a surprise visitor.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Wellington Inn in Hertfordshire where resources manager Felicity Rainbow takes a spiritual approach to hosting - but the `Welly' twist is not a hit with everyone.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at the Strontian Boutique in Strontian, Scotland, where Callum Pegg and his partner head chef Darren Anderson want to treat their guests to an exclusive stay.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the competition is to The Helix Hotel in Grangemouth, Stirlingshire, where host Nawaz Haq wants to show off his hotel, catering to the travelling businessman. Come morning, the group raises concerns over the breakfast banquet.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to The Black Boy Hotel in Sudbury, where hosts Kate Martin and sister Marie Carlton want their guests to kick back and embrace the historical surroundings.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth visit is to The Lodge Bed and Breakfast in Cannock, Staffordshire, where hosts Lee and Marie Garnett are hoping their guests take to their homely BandB, but have they done enough to win?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at the Ship Inn in Dymchurch, Kent run by 21-year-old partners James Tindall and Jessica Walton, who believe age is but a number. Over breakfast, a frank airing of views sets the standard for the week.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Thompson Hall Retreat in Norfolk, run by mother and daughter duo Amanda and Becci. On arrival, everyone is wowed by the stylish shepherd huts with outside bath.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions are simmering as the guests head to The White House in Brighton.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Jacobs Plough in Bicester, Oxfordshire, run by manager Duncan Froomes and bar supervisor Ryan Hunt who like to mix banter with business. The criticism continues, with feedback that leaves the hosts praying for a miracle.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at stately home Anstey Hall in Cambridge, with father and son combo John and Johnny de Bruyne.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the competition is to clothes-free Clover Spa and Hotel in Birmingham where owner Tim Higgs hopes to convert his rivals to the joys of naturism.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to Higher Gitcombe, in Totnes, Devon, where owners Paul and Lynnie Jolly set out to spoil their guests rotten.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
The venue is The Runaway Girl, a tapas bar-cum-nightclub in Sheffield city centre on the brink of collapse. The restaurant is losing money by the bucket-load and the two best friends who run it are at war with each other. The owner Justin Rowntree won't listen to reason, and his head chef and best friend Ritchie has had enough. To make matters worse the credit crunch has hit and there is fierce competition from corporate chains.
Gordon is on hand to help the friend's weather the storm with a credit crunch menu solution designed to take on the chains, but can Gordon save Justin's failing business, and prevent his friendship with Ritchie ending up in tatters?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
The Dovecote is a bistro in the heart of rural Devon run by a family at breaking point. The restaurant is on its last legs - they've run out of customers, money and hope. Enter Gordon, who on his first visit to the bistro is confronted with hideous wallpaper, vacuum packed lamb and a pig-headed head chef and owner who can't face up to his mistakes. Gordon has a torrid time putting them on the road to recovery, but come the autumn, they are sticking to his rules and business is looking brighter.
With the advent of the credit crunch, soaring food prices, thrifty clientele and unrelenting competition from the high street chains, Gordon is determined to galvanise the owners, the staff and the local community to ensure their survival and keep customers coming back for more.

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S05:E10 - Episode 10

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S05:E11 - Episode 11

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's final programme is The Granary in rural Hampshire, an upmarket restaurant which - at 200 seats - is the biggest Gordon's ever taken on. Originally opened by entrepreneur Nigel Nieddu as an up-market dining club four years ago, the restaurant was relaunched after a ~2m refit, but it's still losing ~4k a week. It promises classy modern British cuisine but in reality the fussy menu features food sourced from all over the globe and the locals, disconcerted by its exclusive reputation, are staying far away. Head Chef Martin doubles as parole officer to his unruly teenage charges in the kitchen, while Nigel stubbornly struggles to contain the front-of-house chaos that he's created.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's programme is The Fish & Anchor, a restaurant and bar near Lampeter in rural West Wales, owned and run by ex-boxer Mike and his wife Caron. Mike, a self-taught cook, is a one-man pressure cooker in the kitchen as he struggles to accommodate a vast menu while Caron's unique style of front-of-house management includes abusing the customers and her husband in equal measure. Every night they go twelve rounds with the local clientele who are fast deserting them to the tune of a ~¬£1,000 per week loss.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dessert is the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges and the pressure in the kitchen is intense. Angela Malik is cooking a technically challenging dessert.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two Scottish chefs must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. They're hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver. They are joined by guest judge Gary Parsons.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Determined newcomers Paul Croasdale and Nick Brodie take on returning chef Phil Carmichael for a place in the national finals. It's Phil's third time in the competition and this year he's determined to make it to the banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The pressure in the kitchen is high as the chefs prepare their fish courses. Paul Croasdale is trying to recreate the elegance of Wimbledon with luxury ingredients such as king crab and scallops.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: For the main course, all three chefs are cooking Welsh lamb in the hope of impressing the judge. Phil is taking a risk with barbecued lamb and in an attempt to elevate a humble barbecue to banquet level, he's serving it with many accompaniments.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the dessert course and the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges so all three chefs are feeling the pressure. Phil Carmichael creates a tennis ball dessert that combines two British classics, Eton mess and trifle.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two winning chefs from the Wales region must cook their entire taste of summer menus again. They're hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges and guest judge Dan Bloxham, Wimbledon's Master of Ceremonies.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Pip Lacey's starter is a humorous take on the unpredictable British weather and features an unusual presentation. Ryan Simpson's dish represents an allotment complete with soil, while Nick Deverell-Smith's creation is a tribute to the precision cutting of Wimbledon's grass.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With the chefs hoping to impress, they each take risks. Pip Lacey combines lobster with strawberry in a tribute to strawberries and cream. Ryan Simpson's also using lobster in his recreation of a BBQ and has invented a technique to create his chips.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Ryan Simpson hopes to elevate a ploughman's lunch into a gourmet affair, Pip Lacey pays tribute to an unusual Wimbledon icon, while Nick Deverell-Smith looks to celebrate a meat which he thinks is underused, venison.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dessert is the last chance for the chefs to secure a place cooking for the judges. Pip Lacey's pineapple dessert uses coriander. Nick Deverell-Smith also pays tribute to the pineapple, creating a dessert featuring a rice pudding made with couscous.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two chefs who've made it through cook their four courses again. They must impress the formidable panel of judges Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort, Andi Oliver and guest judge Jordanne Whiley, one of Britain's most successful wheelchair tennis players.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs meet their surprise veteran judge and cook their starters. Eddie is hoping to do better than last year, Joery is hoping to impress with a tribute to Richard Krajicek, and Tommy is creating a warm salad.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Joery Castel is combining mackerel and cucumber, and Tommy Heaney hopes his Murray Mound is a fitting tribute to Andy Murray's love of sushi. Eddie Attwell is creating five different strawberry elements to accompany the scallops in his dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Tommy Heaney's BBQ dish is a surf and turf combination, Joery Castel's aiming to recreate a more American-style BBQ and Eddie Attwell's taking a risk with an unusual meat.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Tommy Heaney's BBQ dish is a surf and turf combination, Joery Castel's aiming to recreate a more American-style BBQ and Eddie Attwell's taking a risk with an unusual meat.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two chefs who have made it through cook their four courses again. They are hoping to impress the formidable panel of judges, Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver, who are joined by tennis's greatest entertainer, Mansour Bahrami.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With finals week ahead of them, judge Andi Oliver first summons the chefs to Wimbledon to take a look at where they could be cooking if they win. The judges are joined by guest judge Sue Barker, host of the Wimbledon coverage for more than 20 years.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs must cook their fish courses but with some exceptionally high scoring dishes in the regional heats, each chef will need to deliver perfection in order to see off the competition. The judges are joined by guest judge Tim Henman.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is main course day and with only two spots remaining on the banquet menu, the competition is fierce. As the barbecues are fired up, all eight chefs are feeling the heat. The judges are joined by guest judge Gordon Reid.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is dessert day and with just one place remaining at the Wimbledon banquet, each chef is giving everything they have got. The judges are joined by guest judge Annabel Croft, former British number one and Junior Wimbledon champion.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the grand finale and the winning chefs must now cook their dishes at the banquet. Once in the kitchen, the chefs face the huge challenge of scaling up their dishes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Competing for top spot are Danny Parker, head chef at Michelin starred `House of Tides' in Newcastle, who is back to try his luck in the competition again after being knocked out in the regional heat last year following a tense tie-break. He's taking on two newcomers: Dan Fletcher, prot√©g√© of Phil Howard, and now head chef at `Fenchurch' in the City of London, and David Coulson,who runs `Peace and Loaf' in Newcastle, which boasts 2 AA rosettes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: After a tense starter course the chefs are all aiming for 10s with their unique fish dishes. David is celebrating a personal connection to the brief with his `My Cod I Bet Me Ma'am Has Seen Some Trotters', a tribute to his mum who has worked as a chiropodist. Dan's `For All Those Sleepless Nights' pays tribute to nightshift workers from the NHS with some bold but classic flavours while Danny's `Not All Superheroes Wear Capes' aims to give a taste of luxury to the hardworking staff.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Dan pays tribute to an icon of modern nursing, Florence Nightingale, while Danny is inspired by the founder of the NHS, Aneurin Bevan. David's dish is dedicated to the air ambulance staff who saved the life of his fianc√©, and he even takes a trip to meet one of them.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the chefs' last chance to impress and tensions are high. Dan takes a risk with an unusual combination of ewe's milk and bergamot while Danny is determined to pull out all the stops with his complex dessert `Aunty Gwen's Chocolate'. David hopes to transform a childhood comfort classic into a show stopping dessert. Dan also takes a trip to meet Dr Ben Clarke who was working in the Royal London Hospital A&E during the London Bridge terror attack.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining North East chefs must cook their four-course menus again, but will they take on board their veteran's advice as they serve their `Feast To Say Thank You'?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Banquet champion Selin Kiazim, a rising star of the London scene renowned for her Turkish Cypriot fusion flavours, is back hoping to join the elite group of chefs who have made it to the banquet twice. She is up against James Cochran who's worked at some of London's toughest kitchens including 2 Michelin starred `The Ledbury' and Scott Goss from `The Twenty Six' in Tunbridge Wells, renowned for his use of local Kent ingredients.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs do battle for the fish course and the atmosphere in the kitchen is tense. Lobster is catch of the day for James whose dish is Caribbean-inspired. Scott is attempting to elevate a classic fish pie, dedicated to his mum who worked as a pharmacist in the NHS for 23 years. And Selin is taking a risk with a complex three-part fish dish featuring sardines, scallops and langoustines, as a nod to the purported health benefits of a Mediterranean diet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Scott is showcasing rare-breed Tamworth pork to say thank you to the rare breed of people who work for the NHS. Selin is serving a complex duck dish using ingredients from all around the world to honour `Our Global NHS'. And James is presenting five cuts of goat cooked in five different ways, for his bold dish `Under The Knife'.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Selin puts her own unique twist on tea and toast. James creates a decadent coconut parfait accompanied by mango puree filled doughnuts for his dessert `Tree of Life' inspired by the coconut palm tree, the NHS and both of their contributions to our health. Scott hopes his elevated gypsy tart `Honey Bee Good' will secure him a place in the final.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining London and the south east chefs must cook their four-course menus again, but will they take on board their veteran's advice as they remake their `Feast To Say Thank You'?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Vying to be crowned champion of Scotland are three newcomers to the GBM kitchen. Lorna McNee is a former Scottish Chef of the Year and is renowned for her technical precision, gained from working at two-Michelin-starred restaurant `Andrew Fairlie'.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and the chefs are all out to impress. The heat is increased as all three serve their unique takes on lobster. Ross seeks victory with his dish `Lobster Aid'. Lorna's `Live Well, Live Very Well' features only three elements.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Ross is hoping to impress with `Oh Deer It's Time For Your Penicillin', his tribute to Scottish scientist Alexander Fleming featuring an unusual yeast element as well as venison. Across the kitchen, Lorna, a former Game Chef of the Year, is also cooking venison in a bid to impress.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Ross is attempting to elevate a classic into a dish worthy of the banquet, Lorna is cooking a personal tribute to NHS staff using unusual yuzu and tonka bean flavours, and Ben is serving an experimental dish which includes a bees wax ice cream.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is judging day and the two remaining chefs must impress the panel of Oliver Peyton, Andi Oliver and Matthew Fort. Both chefs are gunning for success and are doing everything they can to deliver their menus to perfection.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three chefs compete in the heat for the central region. Returner Ryan Simson-Trotman, who failed to reach the national finals last year, is originally from Nuneaton and opened his own restaurant Orwells in the Oxfordshire countryside with his partner Liam, who is also a contestant in the North West region.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and the chefs are pulling out all the stops. Marianne pays tribute to the `angels' in her local hospital who looked after her during a recent illness, and Ryan's dish is a reference to the purported health benefits of fish high in omega 3 oils, while Sabrina is inspired by her aunt, a retired nurse who used to take in food to share with her fellow workers during her shifts.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs cook their mains and, following the previous day's results, tension is high. Both Marianne and Ryan are cooking muntjac in the hope of impressing the veteran judge, while Sabrina is making an ambitious technical take on a family feast.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With one dish left to impress the veteran judge, the chefs cook their desserts. Marianne is looking to raise a smile with her `carry on' themed dessert, complete with surprise presentation. Sabrina hopes to make it through with an elevated take on jelly and ice cream while Ryan goes all out with his very sweet treat `A Spoonful of Sugar'.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining central region chefs do battle for a place in the national finals. They must impress the formidable panel of Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton with their four-course menus.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Andrew is attempting to pay tribute to NHS staff with his take on a traditional healing recipe, `Mum's Flu-Fighting Chicken Soup'. Jason's `A Tea From The Heart' is a play on a post-war remedy which harks back to the era when the NHS was formed.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: After the starter results, the chefs return to the kitchen hoping for high scores with their fish dishes. Chris once again is using ingredients he has foraged from around his restaurant, while Jason hopes to impress with a spicy scallop dish and Andrew prepares a cod dish with 11 different elements.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs are pulling out all the stops in a bid for big scores with their mains. All three dishes pay tribute to the founder of the NHS Aneurin Bevan, Chris's `Everything But The Squeal' is an ambitious pork sharing platter, while Jason's `For The Rich And The Poor' showcases lamb, and Andrew is hoping to impress with `Aneurin Bevan For Better Steak'.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the dessert course and the last opportunity for the chefs to impress. Chris is hoping to triumph with another dish which showcases the foraged ingredients available around his restaurant, while Jason attempts a technical feat in his dessert inspired by a childhood hospital stay and Andrew is inspired by a dish by his great grandmother used to cook. Which two will make it through to the judging chamber?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the Wales regional final as the two remaining chefs do everything they can to impress the judging panel of Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. After tensions ran high in the week, the chefs are under pressure to deliver perfection. The judges are joined by Aneira Thomas, the first baby born on the NHS, who is named in tribute to the service's founder Aneurin Bevan and who went on to dedicate her life to the service. Who will win a place in the national finals?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the turn of three chefs representing the south west, including two who have competed before but meet in the kitchen this week for the very first time. The chefs meet their surprise veteran judge and cook their celebratory starters.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course and with Tom renowned as a fish specialist all eyes are on him. He's cooking his take on a classic British fish supper in tribute to a charity which looks after the health of local fishermen. Jude is attempting a complex fusion dish featuring four different fish and an unusual X Ray themed presentation, while Olivia is paying tribute to the staff who looked after her during the birth of her first son with her take on curried monkfish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the main course and two of the chefs are hoping duck will win the day. Tom is preparing a technically challenging duck dish steeped in NHS history while Jude is making a multi-element Chinese duck dish inspired by his mum. Olivia is hoping her dish, using two unusual cuts of beef, will score top points. Olivia also visits her local children's hospital, home of the second busiest paediatric A&E in the country.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With just one more chance to impress their veteran judge, the chefs are all hoping to use their pastry skills to deliver technically complex desserts. Tom's cooking an `Invalid Fruit Tart' inspired by a 1950s recipe, while Jude is making six different apple elements for his `An Apple A Day'. Olivia is using stout in reference to an outdated old wives' tale which suggested the drink was a healthy source of iron during pregnancy.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's time for the two remaining chefs representing the South West to go head to head as they cook their menus again for the exacting panel of Andi Oliver, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. With a spot in the National Finals at stake, both are aiming for perfection as they bid for glory. The judges are joined by Barbara Childs, a Matron in the Cardiac Intensive Care Unit at Great Ormond Street Hospital, who isn't afraid to speak her mind in the chamber.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three chefs take to the kitchen in a bid to represent the north west in the national final. They include Ellis Barrie, from the award winning Marram Grass in Anglesey, Liam Simpson-Trotman, an accomplished pastry chef and co-owner of the 4 AA rosette Orwell's in Oxfordshire, and Craig Sherrington, who sharpened his skills working under top names including Eric Chavot and is now Chef Patron of Virginia House in Cumbria.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course and the chefs are all gunning for tens. Craig pays tribute to a friend who has revolutionised hospital food in Morecambe Bay, while Liam is inspired by health advice his grandma gave him and Ellis is dedicating his dish to the staff who delivered his son Albert. With cod, mackerel, shrimp and cockles on the menu, which of the chefs will score highly?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Time for the chefs to cook their mains and the pressure is on. Craig is hoping to impress using two cuts of Dexter beef, while Liam prepares his take on a Bajan lamb stew and Ellis prepares four cuts of suckling pig. Liam meets his personal hero, Nola Ishmael OBE, who became the UK's first ever black Director of Nursing.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the dessert course and the last chance for the North West chefs to impress in a bid to make it through to the regional final. Liam is cooking `Not So Hot Toddy' in honour of a friend who works nightshifts in the NHS, while Ellis' `Worth Their Weight in Gold' is dedicated to the staff who saved his brother's life and Craig's dish `The Missed Celebration' pays tribute to his wife with an unusual Christmas concept.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two highest scoring chefs from the week return to cook their menus again. Judging them are Matthew Fort, Oliver Peyton and Andi Oliver who are joined by Dr Jake Dunning MBE, an infectious disease specialist who has been recognised for his work during the West Africa Ebola epidemic.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three chefs are doing battle to represent Northern Ireland. Tommy Heaney, Head Chef at the Great House Hotel in South Wales is taken on by Shauna Froydenlund, Chef Patron at Marcus Wareing's two Michelin starred restaurant and James Devine, the 2017 National Chef of the Year.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: After a tense starter course, the chefs return to the kitchen to cook their fish dishes. James is making his elevated take on a fried chicken takeaway as a tribute to the NHS staff who care for his sister. Shauna is also taking inspiration from a personal connection with a tribute to staff from a facility in her hometown of Londonderry. Tommy is hoping to impress with a dish dedicated to the discovery of DNA.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With two courses down it's time for the chefs to cook their main courses. It's the battle of beef with each using the same meat in their innovative creations. Tommy also meets the first baby ever born on the NHS.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the dessert course and the final chance for the chefs to impress. After such a tightly fought battle all week, each is hoping to deliver a technically perfect dessert. Tommy and James are both using passion fruit in their complex dishes while Shauna is hoping to use her pastry chef training to score full marks.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two chefs representing Northern Ireland go head to head. Judging as ever are Oliver Peyton, Matthew Fort and Andi Oliver who are joined by Shehan Hettiaratchy, lead trauma surgeon at St Mary's Hospital who helped treat victims of the Grenfell Tower fire.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The winning chefs from all eight regions must battle it out for the honour of a spot on 2018's `Feast To Say Thank You' banquet menu, celebrating 70 years of the NHS, one of Britain's most prized institutions.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs must cook their fish courses but after some exceptionally high-scoring dishes in the starter round, everyone is desperate to deliver perfection. Once again the chefs present their innovative, witty or heart-warming creations.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's main course day and with only two spots remaining on the banquet menu, the competition is fierce. Both chefs and judges alike are amazed at the high standard of cooking and an incredible number of 10s are dished out as the chefs serve up venison, rabbit, duck, beef, lamb and pork for scrutiny.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's dessert day and with just one place remaining at the banquet feast, each chef is giving everything they've got for a chance to say thank you to the heroic NHS staff. All the chefs have significantly re-worked or re-invented their desserts since the regional heats, proving that they'll do everything they can in a bid for that final winning spot.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the grand finale as the winning chefs cook their dishes at a banquet for the heroes of the NHS. Having arrived at St Bartholomew's Hospital, the chefs are shown the incredible location for event, the almost three-hundred-year-old Great Hall.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Andrew Pern, Stephanie Moon and Tim Bilton prepare their starters which include potted venison with watercress and crisp fennel salad, `salmagundi' of North County produce, and sticky pigeon breast, forager's relish, hedgerow and beetroot crisps.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Andrew Pern, Stephanie Moon and Tim Bilton prepare their fish dishes: seafood stew, fish soup with a toasted kipper club sandwich and hot oak smoked Kilnsey trout, golden tea cream and Daleside scraps.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Marik's good half possesses Tea again and begs Yugi to destroy him along with his evil side,but he eventually weakens and begins fading away as his dark half loses life points. Yugi and the Pharaoh become hesitant to duel, not wanting to harm the good Marik. As he fades away, Marik appears to an unconscious Odion, thanks him for taking care of him and apologizes, wishing that he could take back his cruel actions. In a cliffhanger, Odion is revealed to have been awakened by Marik's apology.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi continues fending off Marik's attacks, holding out until he has the cards he needs to defeat Marik. Finally, he summons Dark Magician and Dark Magician Girl and uses them to activate Ragnarok¬†‚Äì a spell card with the ability to destroy all the monsters on Marik's field, including The Winged Dragon of Ra that he fused himself with.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Odion tries to get the good Marik to resist his evil half. As a result, Yami Marik becomes angered, and attacks Odion with the Millennium Rod, which weakens Odion even more. Odion doesn't give up, despite Ishizu's protests. As Marik continues his onslaught (which begins to injure Odion), Odion tells Marik's good side that together, they had conquered his evil half before, and that they could do it again. Then, he tells the good Marik that since Yami Marik was created by the good Marik's hatred, he has the power to destroy him. As Yami Marik raises the Rod to deliver the final blow, the good Marik disappears from the field, and begins fighting against Yami Marik, who struggles for control over Marik's body, and refuses to be defeated. However, Marik's good half stalls Yami Marik long enough for Yugi to activate his spell card. Yugi's Ragnarok spell succeeds in destroying (and removing to the graveyard) Ra, allowing the good Marik to regain control of his body. However, a sliver of Yami Marik reappears on the field, although this time, he is the victim. Yami Marik tries to convince the good Marik to help him seize the Millennium Items and rule the world together, but fails as Marik has decided to stop being evil and make up for his actions. Marik surrenders the duel to Yugi, which sends Yami Marik to the Shadow Realm, ending the Battle City finals. Bakura and Mai are returned from the shadow realm and Marik is reunited with his siblings, who forgive him. Yugi receives the three Egyptian God Cards. programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: With the Spring of 23‚Äô Turkey Seasons still in full swing and tags still left to fill‚Ä¶ I wanted to rerelease the ‚Äúbest of turkey season past‚Äù. The beginning clips shows the 2020 Single Season Archery Grand Slam in 38 Days! The second clips are my attempt to repeat in 2021!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: Low turkey numbers and a few trespassers made this season tougher than normal. John hits a couple states in pursuit of a few gobblers, but ends up not punching his last tag for a reason that is not to common and often not discussed in conservation circles.

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: Never in a million years did I think I would be in Spain, much less hunting‚Ä¶ An opportunity to chase true 100% Balerian Goats on the island of Mallorca presented itself after the 2023 season was already planned and set in motion. What do you? You make every effort to make it happen! Logistics, flight delays, and language barriers turned a 4 day hunt into 2. Witnessing their conservation efforts was definitely the highlight of the trip. Although different, it very much works for them and something others could learn from as we hunt to protect these species. Saddle up for a wild 2 days!

programme.title: Primal Divide

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: In this episode, John returns to Colorado and looks to connect with another archery velvet mule deer. With a great week of weather ahead, there should be plenty of stalk opportunities!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: An unusually warm Iowa November led John to hunting clover food plots and a bit of deja vu. A buck John passed several times in 2022 would resurface on the same plot, and walk the same path as he did exactly 1 year prior to the day, only 30 mins off. Do you believe deer will repeat themselves? This episode might make you think so!!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: Usually my summers are filled with trail cameras, food plots, and prepping for the whitetail season. This year I actually got ahead of the game and was able to carve out a week to go try some new hunting‚Ä¶. Bowfishing! I love to shoot bows and I love to fish, why not do them both at the same time?! It took awhile to get dialed in, but once I learned the refraction of the water & lights, thing heat up fast!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: Low turkey numbers and a few trespassers made this season tougher than normal. John hits a couple states in pursuit of a few gobblers, but ends up not punching his last tag for a reason that is not to common and often not discussed in conservation circles.

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: Never in a million years did I think I would be in Spain, much less hunting‚Ä¶ An opportunity to chase true 100% Balerian Goats on the island of Mallorca presented itself after the 2023 season was already planned and set in motion. What do you? You make every effort to make it happen! Logistics, flight delays, and language barriers turned a 4 day hunt into 2. Witnessing their conservation efforts was definitely the highlight of the trip. Although different, it very much works for them and something others could learn from as we hunt to protect these species. Saddle up for a wild 2 days!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: When Under Armour became the Title Sponsor of the Tactical Games, well‚Ä¶. I actually learned what the Tactical Games were. Kinda cross fit, kinda strong man all mixed with AR and pistol shooting. Ok, Sign me up!! But what did I just sign up for?! I was about to find out!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: In this episode, John returns to Colorado and looks to connect with another archery velvet mule deer. With a great week of weather ahead, there should be plenty of stalk opportunities!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: An unusually warm Iowa November led John to hunting clover food plots and a bit of deja vu. A buck John passed several times in 2022 would resurface on the same plot, and walk the same path as he did exactly 1 year prior to the day, only 30 mins off. Do you believe deer will repeat themselves? This episode might make you think so!!

programme.title: Primal Divide
programme.desc: Usually my summers are filled with trail cameras, food plots, and prepping for the whitetail season. This year I actually got ahead of the game and was able to carve out a week to go try some new hunting‚Ä¶. Bowfishing! I love to shoot bows and I love to fish, why not do them both at the same time?! It took awhile to get dialed in, but once I learned the refraction of the water & lights, thing heat up fast!

Though no one is willing to listen to the innocent prisoner's pleas for freedom, Brick's faithful fianc√©e, Mary (Maureen O'Sullivan), knows that her lover is innocent -- because she was with him when the crime was committed. As the scheduled execution draws ever nearer, Mary begins to investigate the murder herself.

Still, all the money and fame in the world can't buy happiness, and Rita is plagued with depression over her broken relationships -- first to a handsome soldier (Steve Hill) and then to a boxing promoter (Lloyd Bridges) -- and her lack of any emotional connections to anyone outside of her professional life.

When Maxine convinces the police captain (Clarence Kolb) to threaten Kenny with suspension, Kenny shows his dedication by accepting a case requiring him to dress as a woman. With a killer on the loose, Kenny must decide between his career obligations and his fianc√©e's wishes.

programme.desc: Toby is brought in to investigate some corrupt cops, but finds himself in over his head when one of them ends up dead from a suspected drug overdose.

programme.title: The Listener
programme.desc: An imprisoned criminal mastermind holds the key to the whereabouts of a kidnapped judge.

programme.title: The Listener

programme.title: The Listener

programme.title: The Listener
programme.desc: A break in a six-month cyber crime investigation leads Michelle and Dev to pursue a reckless hacker.

programme.title: The Listener

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride and the team reunite with conspiracy journalist Oliver Crane after the source for his latest story is murdered; Hannah's former partner, Liam Somers, surprises her and shares a shocking revelation about an old case.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The team investigates multiple murders tied to a construction company that creates an experimental chemical that strengthens sea walls; evidence from Hannah's previous mission in Oman is used against her.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: After an elusive terrorist with a personal vendetta against Hannah resurfaces, she and her family are placed in protective custody while the team searches for the suspect.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: After a reshuffling of assignments, Pride returns to the New Orleans office during the investigation of a missing petty officer.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The NCIS team investigates the murder of Patton's friend, a former Navy SEAL gunned down in a drive-by shooting while Patton watched.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A Navy lieutenant from a well-connected and affluent family has a fatal fall down a flight of stairs at a charity gala; the team investigates whether his death was an accident or foul play.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: When Elvis Bertrand's "daughter" is linked to a murder case, he asks Pride to prove her innocence.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Tammy is convinced that a con man committed the hit-and-run murder of a Navy doctor, even though the evidence shows otherwise; unbeknownst to Hannah, her husband approaches Pride with new intel on an underground spy network.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The NCIS team investigates a deadly bombing at a military museum event with over 1,000 people in attendance.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Pride and Lasalle travel to war-torn South Ossetia to locate an FBI agent who was kidnapped during a failed mission to apprehend the leader of Apollyon, the underground spy network responsible for murdering Pride's father.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: In Peru, IN, greed and lust chip away at a power couple's relationship; in rural Iowa, neighbors are at war.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: In Buford, GA, a wife begins a cyber affair which has deadly consequences; in Raleigh, NC, a medical aids researcher suffers unusual medical problems his doctors can't explain.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: In Silverthorne, Colorado, a photographer's wife seems to have mysteriously vanished in the night, until detectives learn he has a violent past; in Darby, Montana, a husband is dead, and Police have two suspects - his wife and mistress.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: In Easton, Pennsylvania, a lesbian love triangle spins out of control; in Gillette, Wyoming, a desperate housewife has a shocking tale of murder and revenge.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: In Wilkes-Barre, Pennsylvania, Police respond to a report of a vicious home invasion; in Olathe, Kansas, a brutal murder sends shockwaves through Bible country.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: At Lake Mohave, Nevada, a fisherman stumbles across a human skull; in the North West of England, a husband claims his wife has left him for another man, but no one can find her.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: In Lexington, Kentucky, a newly wed wife parties like there's no tomorrow, until a body is dumped on a golf course; in Brisbane, Australia, there are fears for the safety of a missing wife.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
programme.desc: In Poughkeepsie, New York, a police officer discovers his wife is cheating on him, leading to a deadly encounter; in Orlando, Florida, a woman gets herself a boy toy with fatal results.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Long-suppressed family secrets, stolen ancient artefacts, and a thirty year old death at a Celtic burial site result in a series of murders in present day Midsomer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Midsomer hosts its 12th Annual Literary Festival, an author is found with his neck broken. More writers will die before the winner of the competition is announced.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: DCI Tom Barnaby and DS Dan Scott investigate the shotgun murder of Jamie Cruikshank, a barman at the Maid in Splendour, a pub in the village of Midsomer Worthy.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the curate of the local church in Midsomer Parva is burned alive in the effigy of the straw woman, DCI Tom Barnaby and DS Dan Scott find themselves investigating what must be a murder.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The team searches for a group of video gamers that has started to play the game in real life, killing police officers, stealing evidence, raping women, and robbing a bank.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Horatio and his team investigate the murder of a suspected drug lord as one member of the group is arrested for buying marijuana.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: New technology helps find the true rapist in a cold case, but he is murdered before he can go to trial.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: A man is murdered while trying to learn how to pick up women at a hip Miami nightclub.

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: When a female executive is shot at an afternoon concert, the evidence leads the team to suspect that the dreaded Mala Noche gang has struck again.

programme.title: Super Sleuths - Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Midsomer Murders team opens up about their experience of working on the popular crime drama and provides insight into the overall process of bringing it to the small screen.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Peter and Caroline Cave are house-hunting in Midsomer Newton. Shortly before leaving their hotel they mention they haven't been able to find what they're looking for; "something old and derelict that they can do up." Anne Merrick tells them about Winyard, a tumbledown cottage in the woods, might be for sale. At the estate agents they are told the house is not yet available for viewing. Later that evening they find the house on their own. However, Caroline has read up on the cottage's haunted reputation and only reluctantly explores it with Peter. The next morning they are found strangled in their own car. DCI Barnaby starts the investigation with the help of PC Ben Jones and they come across the world of estate agents, identical twins, ghosts, piano wire, and more before another body turns up.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Could a ballad made famous by late, lamented folk singer Johnny Carver be an inspiration for murder? Did someone want to kill Toby Winning for threatening to take the Little Crosby Folk Festival away from Midsomer - or is the true motive something hidden for 20 years?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the boss of Calder's Biscuit Company is murdered in Copenhagen, Barnaby and Nelson join forces with two female Danish detectives, the abrasive and astute Poulsen and the charming and cool Degn. They discover Eric Calder had more linking him to Copenhagen than just his famous Golden Clusters.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Exactly nine years after Ferdy Villers killed himself, his entire family reunites for Christmas unaware that someone is out for revenge.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When DCI Barnaby and DS Troy arrive in the sleepy village of Badger's Drift to investigate the sudden death of elderly Miss Emily Simpson, her next door neighbour insists that she had been murdered, after she had seen her return from a walk in the woods, unnerved and shocked by something she had witnessed. When the post mortem confirms her death was no accident, the pair discover that nothing is what it seems to be within the little village as they try to find out what exactly she saw. Their investigation introduces Barnaby and Troy to many eccentric and quirky residents and soon turns up a web of sex, blackmail and lies, and the possibility that the murder could be connected to a shooting accident two years ago, which claimed another woman's life.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The closing of what was once a very popular public garden in Midsomer Deverell sparks a series of murders that have Inspector Barnaby and Sgt. Troy stumped.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Following the funeral of local hotelier Karl Wainwright, his hotel's manager and a well liked Punch and Judy performer, Gregory Chambers, disappears unusually in yet another picturesque Midsomer village. Most people dismiss his disappearance completely but when he doesn't turn up, a search is conducted and a severed hand, confirmed to be Gregory's, turns up in the woods. Further deaths and a mushroom poisoning occur surrounding the beneficiaries of Karl Wainwright's will. All is not as it seems.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A man's naked body found under mysterious circumstances, within a crop circle on Sir Harry Chatwyn's wheat field, leads police to investigating how he wound up in the field after being electrocuted. While the nearby village of Midsomer Parva is abuzz with UFO mania, Barnaby is unconvinced by a local ufologist that the man's death was the result of alien activity, as he uncovers rivalries, theft and hatred during his investigations, soon after a well known burglar is found dead in another crop circle with identical injuries.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Returning home one night, in a drunken state, the local doctor of Newton Magna calls in the police after he had accidentally hit a man, yet when Barnaby and Troy arrive, the injured man is nowhere to be found. As they investigate the mystery, Barnaby encounters an old adversary who is working to help renovate the village and whose daughter is getting married to a local boy. Matters soon become complicated, when the body of the best man's father is found in a well that was being renovated, whom the detectives soon discover had disappeared on the day he was planning to run away with a local farmer's wife.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Dave Cutler, Goodman's Land's amorous postman, is found almost decapitated near the common early one morning. Newspaper girl Holly Reid (Kate Maberly) tells Barnaby that she heard music playing faintly nearby. Barnaby and Troy are aided in their investigations by local WPC Jay Nash (Gillian Kearney).

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Troy tackle two separate cases as Troy prepares to leave Midsomer after his promotion to DI.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby's new Sergeant arrives on the day after the murder of a local shrew occurs, and he is immediately put to work.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Long-suppressed family secrets, stolen ancient artefacts, and a thirty year old death at a Celtic burial site result in a series of murders in present day Midsomer.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Midsomer hosts its 12th Annual Literary Festival, an author is found with his neck broken. More writers will die before the winner of the competition is announced.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: DCI Tom Barnaby and DS Dan Scott investigate the shotgun murder of Jamie Cruikshank, a barman at the Maid in Splendour, a pub in the village of Midsomer Worthy.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the curate of the local church in Midsomer Parva is burned alive in the effigy of the straw woman, DCI Tom Barnaby and DS Dan Scott find themselves investigating what must be a murder.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Exactly nine years after Ferdy Villers killed himself, his entire family reunites for Christmas unaware that someone is out for revenge.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: As the Barnabys prepare for Cully's wedding, Lord Fitzroy and Beth Porteous are married in the pretty village of Bledlow. At the lavish reception at Bledlow Hall that follows, however, tragedy strikes - maid of honour Marina Fellowes is found murdered in one of the rooms by some of the guests. With their honeymoon cancelled, the Fitzroys must contend with a police presence in their home, as Barnaby and Jones try to learn more about the family history. It soon becomes clear there are secrets, deception, and an illegtimate son involved in the mystery, which is further complicated when the estate manager is killed by an arrow.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: It's a good day for the Hicks family, as the name of Tommy Hicks - who was executed during World War I for "cowardice and desertion" - is added to the list on Midsomer Parva's war memorial. Tommy's son Lionel and grandson Dave, mayor of Causton and whom Barnaby does not like (owing to dodgy building work by the mayor's company), are thrilled, but the snooty Hammonds are decidedly less pleased. Henry, the patriarch of the Hammond family, is particularly riled by his insalubrious neighbours, and has nurtured a long-running feud with the Hickses. But the evening after a battle re-enactment in the village, Henry is murdered - and Barnaby must delve into the history of the two families to find the killer, discovering a web of fraud, lies, and hidden truths.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones are in Dunstan to investigate the deaths of a reclusive couple. As they try to establish whether Ron and Libby Wilson were murdered or died of natural causes, their attention is drawn to a dispute raging between a local builder and road protesters nearby. When another death occurs, the detectives learn that there are plenty of dark secrets and fierce hostilities in this apparently idyllic village. Will Jack Purdy's quick temper lead to violence? How far would the protesters go to prevent the bypass being built? And do current events somehow relate to the death of Michael Wilson many years earlier?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When the body of Londoner Charlie Finleyson is discovered in woodland near Midsomer Sonning, Barnaby and Jones find themselves investigating employees at local Midsomer Life magazine. It turns out the dead man was married to the ex-wife of Guy Sandys, the wealthy owner of the publication. As the detectives become aware of a feud between Guy and the proprietor of the Morecroft Hotel, tensions are also heating up between the locals and visiting Londoners. Soon Barnaby and Jones find themselves to trying to piece together the truth about the murder, and learn that someone might be trying to conceal something in their past.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a pub landlady is crushed to death during a magic show in Midsomer Oaks, Barnaby and Nelson uncover conflict between the village church and ancient pagan traditions. Is famous magician Gideon Latimer to blame or is he the target?

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby and Jones are forced to take part in a team building exercise and Tom has plenty of problems dealing with the young, new, acting Chief Superintendent, John Cotton (Nick Fletcher). Following an explosion in a truck that had been stored in a truck depot, a body is soon discovered in a nearby lake, which turns out to be Alec Grainger, who had been seen arguing with James Parkes (Joseph Millson), the son of Colonel Matt Parkes (Tim Pigott-Smith). James appears to be involved in shady business deals and is blamed by his grandmother Caroline Halsey (Judy Parfitt) - and others - for the suicide of a woman he got pregnant two years before. Barnaby and Jones find themselves delving into a mixture of fraud, smuggling, and lies, trying to piece together the truth.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When two couples vanish into thin air in the village of Monks Barton, Barnaby and Jones hear rumours of haunted woods and witchcraft. Barnaby remains sceptical of this, even when an unidentified body is found in a shallow grave and the missing start turning up dead. He soon has to determine if ghosts, criminals, or something else, is behind the abductions and murders.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When MATTHEW DRAPER, a quarry worker is killed by a demolition charge after obeying the orders of his foreman, IAN FRASER, to return to the unexploded device, no one can predict how it might effect the tranquil village of Fletcher's Cross nine years later...

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: This two-part episode starts with a client asking Danny to find and build a 1979 Camaro Z28, to commemorate the first car he ever owned.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny tries to get the derailed '62 Caddy project back on track, while Ryan tries to make amends for a mishap by finding a flip or two for the shop.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny acquires a '62 Caddy which he hopes will be a huge flip. Ryan devises a secret plan for the car behind Danny's back, but when Danny finds out there's some explaining to do.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: A customer wants to trick out his 2004 Harley Davidson Road Glide, but both Shannon and Ryan aren't sure they can do everything he wants.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Danny has found and bought a replacement for his beloved Dune Buggy "Sparkles." As the guys are turning it into the ultimate 70s beach fantasy.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Ryan is challenged to paint a Harley Trike in the spirit of Van Gogh's "Starry Night," and Kevin finds a car that could be one the most valuable ones Danny has ever seen.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: "Engine Whisperer" Doc has a cool '67 Firebird he's been working on. While he's a mechanical maestro under the hood, his paint skills are lacking so he enlists Ryan.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Rygaard crew gets a surprise visit from logging legend Craig Rygaard; the Zitterkopfs face a major obstacle in their push to complete their largest ever job; Papac battles the Longest Yard unit with its mile long skyline.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Rygaard Logging is trying to get back on track with the help of patriarch Craig Rygaard; the Swampman's under the gun to build an emergency treetop storm shelter; David Zitterkopf's son Levi gets a crucial lesson in logging.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Gabe Rygaard pushes his crew to a breaking point; Gary and Eddie blow up their business to cash in on green gold; David Zitterkopf could see his family empire fall to pieces, with one wrong move; a mutiny is underway among the Chapman crew.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: As Papac Alaska goes deeper into their seven thousand acre site, Joe and Coatsy devise a plan of attack for the next section of this massive project; Rygaard Logging is fighting to get the wood out; Gary and Eddie need to step up their game.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: The Papac crew is moving on to the most remote and treacherous site of their season; the money is drying up for Greg Chapman and his crew is seeing red; Gary and Eddie's new venture is becoming a nightmare.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Mike Papac has to step in as Joe and Coatsey's arguments threaten to bring the job to a grinding halt; David Zitterkopf's back to work after an injury that threatened to end his season.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: A storm's brewing over the Swamp Man and it's threatening to wash away his hopes of filling a huge order; Gabe deals with the aftermath of Aiden's mutiny; the Chapman crew's behind after they burned through their money chasing the Lost Logging Train.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: In Washington, three generations of Rygaard loggers are fighting for the crown; Papack Alaska Logging moves into their final section; Gary and Eddie see if their swamp logging gamble has paid off.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Papac Logging is barely holding onto their lead; the Rygaards will have to work as a team if they're gonna reclaim the title; Shelby Stanga's under the gun, but has a secret map to a possible stash of sunken logs.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Industry titans Pihl Logging and Rygaard Logging tackle some of their most challenging jobs yet; Frank Harkness makes a name for himself; Buckin' Billy Ray takes to the treetops of Vancouver Island, risking his life to keep other people safe.

programme.title: Ax Men
programme.desc: Mike Pihl looks for help from a logging legend; Jason Rygaard faces his biggest test as the new boss; the Harkness crew battles winter storms and vertical terrain in the Cascade Mountains; Wade Etienne goes after valuable hardwood giants.
